text: well Philips has put IOT at the center
of our strategy because we believe the
more we can sense about a person the
more we know about a patient's the
better we can care for them the more
information we can give to the
clinicians and the care teams I think
the big difference is that we've come to
a maturity and price point of sensors
and we have the connectivity of those
sensors now the other side of course is
it generates a whole lot of data and you
need to have the storage and you need to
have the compute power to interpret the
data because what you get from sensors
is useless unless you put it into
context so at the same time we've seen
of course the emergence of cloud
infrastructure and I think looking at
these worlds coming together that
created suddenly this this huge interest
in what IOT can do so the more we can
sense the more we understand that the
better we can control it and I think it
will open up a whole new world of
innovation many things that we haven't
even thought about today it will be as
big as the internet was when it started
